page.title: 03PLANNING PROBLEMS
page.content: The area lies toward the outer limit of the London Green Belt and as such it has some quite particular problems of planning.The local conservation group monitors the changes that take place and have opposed those which threaten village landmarks e.g. The Malt House and the Old Workhouse.The visual integrity of early council estates (Vernon Drive) and Victorian terraces (Newdigate Road) has been destroyed by owner occupation and subsequent ad hoc improvements. Many changes require no planning permission and the nearby M25 increases pressure to convert shops to offices and to develop Green Belt land.In all instances employment prospects must be balanced against loss of amenities and an attempt to reconcile commercial,personal and public interests.
